articles.title: Oracle Claims 'JavaScript' Isn't a Generic Term, and More
articles.description: In this 'motion to dismiss' Oracle has responded to Deno‚Äôs attempt to prove Oracle shouldn't hold the JavaScript‚Ñ¢ trademark with the argument that ‚Äúrelevant consumers do not perceive JAVASCRIPT as a generic term‚Äù (does Oracle only consider people who give it money to be relevant?) among other comedic insights.
articles.author: Ryan Dahl

articles.title: There Are a Lot of Ways to Break Up Long Tasks in JavaScript
articles.description: Due to how browsers and the event loop work, letting a single task hog the main thread is a quick way to freeze up your site‚Äôs UI. Alex explains the problem and uses a simple example to walk through the pros and cons of different solutions from basic use of setTimeout() to requestAnimationFrame(), channel messaging, and Web Workers.
articles.author: Alex MacArthur

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Angular: The Documentary
articles.description: From the creators of the fantastic ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Node.js and ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Ruby on Rails documentaries comes this fresh story covering the ups and downs of the popular Angular (n√©e AngularJS) framework starring a cast of veritable JavaScript luminaries.
articles.author: Honeypot

articles.title: Which Rich Text Editor Framework Should You Choose in 2025?
articles.description: A round-up of actively developed WYSIWYG editor options you can drop into your apps along with the pros and cons of each.
articles.author: Dexemple and Rowny (Liveblocks)

articles.title: How to Publish ESM-Based npm Packages with TypeScript
articles.description: Now that you can use the ES modules (almost) everywhere, it‚Äôs worth understanding how to package them up for use with npm. Axel digs into everything you need to know and shares some useful tools too.
articles.author: Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

articles.title: An Introduction to WebAssembly in Deno
articles.description: How to build a simple WASM module and use it to call Rust code from JavaScript.
articles.author: Jiang and Sherret (Deno)

articles.title: Vite with TypeScript
articles.description: If you‚Äôve created a JavaScript-based React project with Vite and want to get on the TypeScript train, here are the basic steps.
articles.author: Robin Wieruch

articles.title: RE2JS 1.0: Linear Time Matching for Regular Expressions
articles.description: RE2 is a regular expression engine built by Google designed to operate in time proportional to the size of the input, in order to avoid so-called ‚ÄòReDoS‚Äô problems caused by backtracking, and this brings such protection to the browser too.
articles.author: Oleksii Vasyliev

articles.title: Fuse.js 7.1: Lightweight Fuzzy-Search with No Dependencies
articles.description: Want a simple search feature without a dedicated backend? This mature solution could help. Here‚Äôs a live demo.
articles.author: Kiro Risk

articles.title: üé®¬†tinygradient 2.0: A Gradient Generation Library
articles.description: Generate color gradients with an unlimited number of color stops and steps in JavaScript to use as you wish. Supports named colors, hex colors, RGV, HSVa, and RGB CSS strings. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Damien Sorel

articles.title: parse-duration 2.0: Convert a Human Readable Duration to Milliseconds
articles.description: You might wonder why a library that converts 1hr 20mins into 4800000 needs a version 2. Well, it now supports more units (mo, mth, microsec, and nanosec), has moved to ESM, and supports locales.
articles.author: Jake Rosoman

articles.title: Waveform Renderer
articles.description: Quickly create a visual waveform from a MP3 or WAV ‚Äî you can also edit the look. Think of it as a lighter alternative to Wavesurfer.js. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Andres Felipe Alarcon

articles.title: A Protracker Module Player in Pure JavaScript
articles.description: I‚Äôm a sucker for 90s tracker music, JavaScript experiments, and cool Web experiences, and this has all three. If you‚Äôre not familiar with tracker music, it‚Äôs a way to write music on a grid which triggers the playing of samples. This code manages to parse and play a Protracker file in pure JavaScript. (Note: The image above is of the original Protracker app, this experiment is more minimal and about the code.)
articles.author: srtuss

articles.description: Chrome is shipping a new moveBefore DOM method for moving elements around a DOM tree without resetting the element's state. React is already working on using it.
Would you like to write PHP inside Vue or React components? You might if you're a Laravel user, and Aaron Francis shows off a way to do it. It's not open source yet, but his demo is pretty cool.
Nx user? Nx has a whole new experience for Nx workspaces that's faster, more efficient, and solves a variety of issues with TypeScript editor support for large monorepos.
Josh Goldberg explains the differences between ESLint and TypeScript, beyond the obvious.
ES Module Shims 2.0 ‚Äì Polyfills import maps and other ES Modules features on top of the baseline native ESM support in browsers.
pnpm 10.2 ‚Äì The alternative, efficient package manager.
Turborepo 2.4

articles.title: From Pain to Productivity: How I Learned to Code with My¬†Voice
articles.description: After developing severe hand pain, Salma sought an alternative way to code ‚Äî she turned to voice control as a solution. Here she outlines the journey of trying different tools, the accessibility considerations, and her new workflow. She also chatted with Kevin Powell about this change.
articles.author: Salma Alam-Naylor

articles.title: The Mistakes of CSS
articles.description: This post from Juan references an interesting document from the CSS Working Group from a few years back that you may not have seen ‚Äî it outlines some of the ‚Äòmistakes‚Äô made in the design of CSS. ‚Äúthe value of getting things right the first time is a beast of burden‚Äù
articles.author: Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†A Breakdown of Kanye's Weird New Website
articles.description: Whatever you think of Kanye West, you know any project he‚Äôs involved with is going to be a bit.. odd. So it goes with his new e-commerce site which couples a minimal, animated design (reminiscent of the Flash era) along with modern ideas like Web Components and Tailwind, and it all runs on Shopify. Wes digs in to see what we can learn from it.
articles.author: Syntax

articles.title: üìä¬†How Does Ever-Increasing Page Size Affect Your Users?
articles.description: Web performance expert Tammy Everts tells us the median Web page is 8% bigger than a year ago and looks into what effect this has through statistics calculated from the latest data from the HTTP Archive.
articles.author: Tammy Everts

articles.title: Creating an Angled Slider
articles.description: The end result here is pleasing. Zach shows us how to create a angled slider complete with hover effects using just HTML and CSS (mainly grid, clip-path, :has(), and nesting).
articles.author: Zach Saucier

articles.title: üü®¬†How to Favicon in 2025: Three Files That Fit Most Needs
articles.description: Asks us to ‚Äústop the icon generator madness‚Äù and take a smarter approach, adopting a minimal set of icons that fits most modern needs.
articles.author: Andrey Sitnik

articles.title: Avoid Multiple Page Redirects: How Redirects Impact Page Speed
articles.description: Redirects add in steps that can delay page load, in-turn affecting user experience and Core Web Vitals results. As such, this post looks at how to optimize redirects to ensure faster browsing for visitors.
articles.author: Conor McCarthy

articles.title: Pure CSS Mixin for Displaying Values of¬†Custom Properties
articles.description: An article (and associated package) that presents a native CSS mixing that outputs various values as pseudo-elements.
articles.author: Roman Komarov

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Scroll State Queries are on the Way
articles.description: Kevin talks us through what CSS scroll-state brings to the table (available in Chrome 133 beta), along with other recent additions.
articles.author: Kevin Powell

articles.title: Waveform Renderer
articles.description: A browser-based tool for creating a waveform from an audio file. Just add an mp3 or wav file and a waveform will be rendered ‚Äî you can also edit the look. Think of it as a more focused alternative to Wavesurfer.js which also deals with playback, regions, and plugins. Repo here.
articles.author: Andres Felipe Alarcon

articles.title: Plotly 3.0: A JavaScript Graphing Library
articles.description: A high-level, declarative charting library, built on top of D3 and stack.gl, with over 40 chart types, including 3D charts, statistical graphs, and SVG maps. v3 is largely to remove deprecations, fix bugs, and a switch to esbuild.
articles.author: Plotly, Inc.

articles.title: üé®¬†tinygradient 2.0: A Gradient Generation Library
articles.description: Generate color gradients with an unlimited number of color stops and steps in JavaScript to use as you wish. Supports named colors, hex colors, RGV, HSVa, and RGB CSS strings. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Damien Sorel

articles.title: Monoco: A Small JS Library for Smooth 'Squircle' Corners for HTML Elements
articles.description: The main page includes a neat little interactive demo that showcases all the different possibilities for these alternatives to run-of-the-mill rounded corners. Includes implementations for React and Svelte.
articles.author: monokai

articles.title: Tabler 1.0: A Bootstrap 5-Based Open UI Kit for Webapps
articles.description: The 1.0 release of this free, open-source UI kit adds dark theme support, new pages, a faster workflow powered by the Eleventy static site generator, and more.
articles.author: Pawe≈Ç Kuna

articles.title: StyleConsoleLog: An Interactive Tool to Add CSS to Console Messages
articles.description: Uses string substitution along with CSS defined in the second argument, as outlined on MDN here.
articles.author: StyleConsoleLog
